msbt.message: Points: . Rank: . You've certainly collected some interesting pieces in the "" style, eh? There's a sense of unity to your home. Now, aim for completion!
Points: . Rank: . You have a lot of pieces that say, "," and it really ties your house together. Try combining styles to create a living space that is totally you!
Points: . Rank: . It's wonderful that you've collected the complete "" set! It really brings an air of stylish accomplishment to your home.
Points: . Rank: . When yellow furniture is situated to the west... Well, that's just good fêng shui, ! Very nice work placing your .
Points: . Rank: . When green furniture is situated to the south... Well, that's just good fêng shui, ! Very nice work placing your .
Points: . Rank: . When red furniture is situated to the east... Well, that's just good fêng shui, ! Very nice work placing your .
Points: . Rank: . The furniture in your home's is . The color pulls everything together nicely, and it gives your home a refined feel.
Points: . Rank: . Variety is the spice of life...and houses! When you mix things up a bit, your house is better for it. Embrace that spicy variety!
Points: . Rank: . It is the carefully considered opinion of the Happy Home Academy that you deserve bonus points based on your furniture selections. How lucky!
Points: . Rank: . The layout of your home simply oozes originality. It's got a real feel to it. Sometimes it's best to forget about points and just design something FUN.
Points: . Rank: . After careful evaluation, your home has earned the S rank according to the Happy Home Academy. Congratulations! Keep up the good work, and enjoy your lovely home.
Points: . Rank: . After careful evaluation, your home has earned the A rank according to the Happy Home Academy. That's very good, but the S rank is within your reach—we know it!
Points: . Rank: . After careful evaluation, your home has earned the B rank according to the Happy Home Academy. You're off to a great start, and there's still room for improvement!
Points: . Rank: . You have more furniture than most, but thanks to your arrangement, it doesn't feel crowded at all. Well done!
Points: . Rank: . The amount of furniture relative to the size of your home is just right. There's room to live and breathe, but it doesn't ever feel sparse. Excellent balance!
Points: . Rank: . You're using a minimalistic approach to great effect with this layout, but adding a few more tastefully selected items couldn't hurt.
Points: . Rank: . Your is a high-scoring piece! It practically radiates rarity and adds an exclusive cachet to the overall ambience of your home. Bravo!
Points: . Rank: . The highest-scoring room in your home for this assessment was your . We're not sure if it's your favorite room, but it sure feels like it.
Points: . Rank: . The lowest-scoring room in your home for this assessment was your . But that just means it has plenty of room for improvement.
Points: . Rank: . Have you considered branching out with your interior design? Why not try creating something unusual—like a school, or even a store?
Points: . Rank: . Do you feel like your interior design is in a rut? Tired of arranging the same old stuff? Try visiting the shop every day! You never know what you'll find.
Points: . Rank: . Did you know that you can get new furniture from places other than the shop? Like your friends! And try shaking a tree—you never know what might fall out.
Points: . Rank: . Need some fresh ideas about how to decorate your place? Do a little island-hopping and check out your friends' homes for inspiration!
Points: . Rank: . If you're really going for a particular look, you can score big points by collecting all of the furniture in a theme. It's not easy, but it can be worth it.
Points: . Rank: . Accenting your room with items from the same set of furniture can really make a big impact. Even easy-to-find items can sometimes be just the right touch.
Points: . Rank: . Fêng shui isn't everything, but it's not nothing, you know? Try putting yellow items on the west side of your house.
Points: . Rank: . Fêng shui isn't everything, but it's not nothing, you know? Try putting green items on the south side of your house.
Points: . Rank: . Fêng shui isn't everything, but it's not nothing, you know? Try putting red items on the east side of your house.
Points: . Rank: . Did you know that furniture of the same color can net you a higher score, even if each piece is from a different set? Give it a try sometime!
Points: . Rank: . Liven up your space with odds and ends like clocks, plants, musical instruments, and the like. Your home will be colorful and fun, and maybe you'll even score more!
Points: . Rank: . If the seasonal spirit moves you, try using only furniture that you can collect during the current season to decorate!
Points: . Rank: . Some furniture items come with additional bonus points. Earn things like a gold trophy or a photo that is a token of island friendship! Be sure to cherish it!
Points: . Rank: . In general, it's easier to get a higher score if you set out more furniture. Of course, you have to think about how it all ties together too. Balance is key!
Points: . Rank: . Your walls are lovely, sure. But we wouldn't mind if you put up a few more things on them. Go on, give it a try!
Points: . Rank: . May we offer a polite critique? There are...more than a few things strewn about the floor of your home. You know that you can store things you aren't using, right?
Points: . Rank: . A gentle reminder... There are quite a few things strewn about in your . You know you can store things you aren't using, right?
Points: . Rank: . We apologize, but we simply must point out that there is actual trash in your home. Remember, you can use the trash can, or dispose of your trash at the shop.
Points: . Rank: . We apologize, but we simply must point out that there is trash in your . Remember, you can use the trash can or dispose of your trash at the shop.
Points: . Rank: . Did you know that some items will draw a point deduction if they're placed facing a wall? Need an example? Just take a look at your !
Points: . Rank: . Did you know that some items will draw a point deduction if they're placed facing a wall? For example, the in your .
Points: . Rank: . We feel this should be obvious, but it's not good interior design to allow cockroaches to run about your home. This is a major point reduction—please address it!
